results.title: The Amateur gentleman
results.creator_credit: Thornton Freeland, Hal Roach, Douglas Fairbanks, Marcel Hellman, Criterion Films and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film takes place in 1810 England. The hero is Barnaby Barty (Douglas Fairbanks Jr), son of a country innkeeper who is wrongly accused of theft during a visit from Royalty - the Marquis of Camberhurst and his son, Lord Chichester (Basil Sydney). To prove his dad innocent of a crime, Barnaby poses as a famous bare-knuckle gentleman prizefighter. He travels to London and gets involved with London society, royalty, murder and intrigue in his quest to save his father. Based on a novel of the same title by Jeffrey Farnol. Cast includes: Elissa Landi, Margaret Lockwood, Coral Browne, Irene Browne, Gilbert Davis, Gordon Harker, Esme Percy, Frank Pettingell, Athole Stewart and Hugh Williams. Cinematographer: Gunther Krampf.

results.title: The Aluminium age
results.creator_credit: Edwin Scragg, Comalco and Scope Films
results.brief_description: Describes the three steps involved in the making of aluminium; mining bauxite, separating the alumina from impurities, and finally the removal of the oxygen from alumina. The many and varied uses of aluminium are also illustrated. Music by Rory O’Donoghue and Grahame Bond. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: The Alternatives to Infertility
results.brief_description: In this program, the various methods of treatment that are available to infertile couples are listed. The aim of the program is to teach both patients and the community at large about current reproductive technology. The issues of ethics, morality and legality are not discussed.

results.title: The Alternative
results.brief_description: A series of films discussing alternative therapies and presented by leading practitioners who explain how they have treated their client and the positive benefits and effects the therapy has had on their problem.

results.title: The Alphabet dragon
results.brief_description: Presents an animated review of the alphabet. A dragon appears to a peasant couple and grants them twenty-six wishes that must commence with each letter of the alphabet. Along the way they make some foolish choices and eventually end up as they had begun, but having learnt something about wealth and happiness along the way.

results.title: The Allure of drugs
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
This film examines the conflicting attitudes to drugs throughout history. Considers the introduction of coffee and tobacco, prohibition of alcohol and use of drugs in ancient cultures. Points out that periods of change often accompany the introduction of new drugs.

results.title: The Allport collection
results.brief_description: The Allport Collection is a unique assembly of the art of early Tasmania and various objects of the 19th Century, housed in the State Library of Tasmania. In this documentary the curator of the collection gives some insight into its purpose and historical importance. No other credits available.

results.title: The Allan Border tribute match
results.brief_description: In front of a capacity crowd and television audiences Australia-wide, Allan Border’s XI crept home to a last ball win over the International XI. A selection of cricketing legends and sporting personalities were brought together to pay tribute to the man who was one of Australian cricket’s greatest captains and all-round star. Due to the nature of the original footage from the National Nine Network telecast of 19 December 1993, some minor technical faults may appear.

results.title: The all singing all dancing show; Power and prejudice
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Best of British”.
The All singing all dancing show features a time when Britain produced screen musicals that were innovative, exciting and visually stunning. This episode uncovers jewels with scenes from films like “The Red shoes” and “London town”, and a host of stars including Jessie Matthews, Kay Kendall and Moira Shearer. “Power and Prejudice” focuses on films that reflect social attitudes, struggles and problems of ordinary people. Narrated by Sir John Mills.
